thread.title: Controversial bullfighter tossed around ring like ragdoll | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Controversial bullfighter tossed around ring like ragdoll | Daily Mail Online

author: Rachael Burford For Mailonline
title: Controversial bullfighter tossed around ring like ragdoll | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share The other bullfighters quickly came to the rescue, one of them distracting the bull while the others lifted Mr Castella up. The Frenchman suffered only minor injuries and decided to carry on the bullfight until the end. The bullfighter recently caused outrage after an interview where he said: 'Like all animals, bulls do not have duties, therefore they do not have rights.' The bull then turned around and attacked the bullfighter, tossing him up into the air like a ragdoll Mr Castella, 34, was working alongside Roca Rey and Luis Miguel Castrillon when he was injured by the bull. The other bullfighters quickly came to the rescue of their colleague His comments sparked online debates about the culture of bullfighting. Mr Castella responded to the negative comments saying: 'There are so many double morals in this debate, if there weren't then no animal activists would eat meat or have a castrated pet.' The bullring of Santamaria only re-opened this year after left-wing mayor Gustavo Petro decided to close it in 2012. The decision to reopen caused outrage among animal rights activists who staged various protests outside. Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
